Key Match Events: Egypt won 2-0 against Tanzania in an international friendly match at the Cairo International Stadium on Sunday, January 7, 2024.
Mahmoud Hassan ‘Trezeguet’ gave the hosts the lead after 33 minutes, and skipper Mohamed Salah sealed the victory with a second-half penalty, capitalising on a foul on Omar Marmoush in the box.
Pre-Game Insights: Samatta said that playing against one of the African giants was a valuable experience and the perfect build-up before facing Morocco on January 17 at the Laurent Pokou Stadium in San Pédro.
Taifa Stars head coach Adel Amrouche declared, “There is no easy game in the competition, and we need to fight in all matches.”
Post-Match Reflections: Samatta said that there is ample room for the team’s technical bench to rectify mistakes before they compete in the African Cup of Nations (Afcon) finals in Ivory Coast.

Taifa Stars captain Mbwana Samatta shared the lessons learned from facing Egypt. “Egypt is a strong team on the continent, and playing against them has helped us pick up some lessons that we shall work on going into the Afcon.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Taifa Stars will face Morocco on January 17, Zambia on January 21, and DR Congo in the last group match on January 24 in the African Cup of Nations (Afcon) finals in Ivory Coast.
The team’s 27 players are now in Ivory Coast, ready for the competition.
Others: The Taifa Stars attacking midfielder Simon Msuva vies for the ball against Egypt’s Omar Kamal during an international friendly match at the Cairo International Stadium on Sunday.
The Taifa Stars players created numerous scoring opportunities but failed to convert them into goals.
